channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Climate activist Greta Thunberg detained twice at Dutch protest
item.description: The demonstration was organised to protest against fossil fuel subsidies in the Netherlands.

item.title: Myth/Miracle: Dissecting the Modi government’s claims
item.description: How India has fared in the past decade on the foreign policy and economic policy fronts.

item.title: Palestinians and the world must not lose hope
item.description: Those mobilising against the Israeli genocide face exhaustion and burnout. This is part of Israel’s attrition strategy.

item.title: Palestinians mark last days of Ramadan on the eve of six months of war
item.description: As the Muslim fasting month draws to a close next week, many Palestinians spend their days in prayer amid Israel's war.

item.title: Reporting under genocide: Six months in Gaza
item.description: In a special episode of The Listening Post, three Al Jazeera journalists reflect on life throughout this genocide.

item.title: Pakistan slams Indian minister’s remarks on pursuing suspects across border
item.description: Islamabad said the comments undermine peace and impede the prospect of constructive engagement.

item.title: Thousands demonstrate in anti-Orban protest in Hungary
item.description: Protest was led by Peter Magyar, a former government insider who plans to challenge Prime Minister Viktor Orban's party.

item.title: How one Mexican beach town saved itself from ‘death by tourism’
item.description: Stunning Puerto Escondido was on a direct path to destruction. But the community fought back - and won.

item.title: Russia evacuates 4,000 people after dam bursts, floods near Kazakh border
item.description: Authorities warn of dangerous water levels on the Ural river and open an investigation into the dam breach.

item.title: Iran says ISIL members planning Eid al-Fitr ‘suicide attack’ arrested
item.description: ISIL claimed responsibility for twin bombings in Kerman this year that had killed nearly 100 people.

item.title: What is a Godzilla anyway? The 70-year-old monster behind the movies
item.description: Godzilla began life as a symbol of the horrific destruction caused by the atomic bombs dropped on Japan in 1945.

item.title: At least eight killed in Russian strikes on Ukraine’s Kharkiv
item.description: Ukrainian officials say at least 10 others have been injured in the attacks on the eastern border city.

item.title: Pelosi joins US Democrats call for Biden to halt arms transfer to Israel
item.description: Former House speaker among lawmakers putting pressure on White House in letter citing Gaza humanitarian crisis.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 772
item.description: As the war enters its 772nd day, these are the main developments.

item.title: Lebanon’s rock-climbing renaissance
item.description: In a small town in northern Lebanon, a community of rock climbers with its own unique philosophy is taking root.

item.title: Israel’s war on Gaza: List of key events, day 183
item.description: United Nations chief says Israel’s military campaign in Gaza has brought 'relentless death and destruction'.

item.title: Mexico suspends ties with Ecuador after police raid embassy
item.description: Ecuador police storm Mexico's embassy in Quito to arrest former vice president Jorge Glas.

item.title: Philippines flags ‘harassment’ by Chinese vessels ahead of Japan, US drills
item.description: Recent clashes between the Philippines and China in the South China Sea have raised concerns of a maritime escalation.

item.title: Why scores of dogs will honour a Great Dane in Cape Town this weekend
item.description: A quaint local festival celebrates the life of the first dog to receive a Royal Navy rank

item.title: Saving Sarah: The last Jewish embroidery shop in India’s Kochi
item.description: How one Muslim man's deep bond with a Jewish woman in India lives on through the shop she left to him.

item.title: ‘Fishing’: Judge denies Trump team bid to seize NBC Stormy Daniels material
item.description: Judge Juan Merchan criticised the defence team's attempt to compel NBC to turn over documents related to Stormy Daniels.

item.title: Amid diplomatic spat, Mexico grants former Ecuadorian vice president asylum
item.description: Row comes after the Mexican president commented on Ecuador's violence-marred election last year, prompting a rebuke.

item.title: ‘Mission impossible’: Families slam Canada’s Gaza visa scheme as a failure
item.description: No Palestinians have left Gaza thanks to a new Canadian visa programme, fueling anger as Israeli bombardment continues.

item.title: Colombia seeks to join Gaza genocide case against Israel at ICJ
item.description: Bogota calls on the World Court to ensure 'the safety' and 'the very existence of the Palestinian people'.

item.title: First UN food aid in months arrives in Sudan’s Darfur as famine looms
item.description: Aid deliveries follow talks to reopen humanitarian corridors from Chad amid warnings that millions face acute hunger.
